titlestmt.titleproper: Presbyterian Home for Aged Couples and Aged Persons of Philadelphia Young Ladies Auxiliary records 1805-1903
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Presbyterian Home for Aged Couples and Aged Persons of Philadelphia Young Ladies Auxiliary records

bioghist.p: The object of the Young Ladies Auxiliary of the Presbyterian Home for Aged Couples and Aged Persons of Philadelphia was to aid the managers of the home in visiting the inmates and administering to their comfort and cheer. The home was located at 65th and Vine Streets, Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of minute books of the Young Ladies Auxiliary of the Presbyterian Home for Aged Couples and Aged Persons of Philadelphia. Minutes include records of monthly meetings and annual meetings, treasurer's reports, and constitutions and by-laws. Minutes discuss planning of events organized by the Auxiliary, and purchases for the Home and its residents. The collection also includes a list of names of residents of the Home and a list of members of the Auxiliary.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
